title: Energy Analyst, Building Automation Systems (BAS)
description:
Based in Seattle, Optimum Energy is the leader in developing software solutions that optimize the energy consumption of HVAC systems, delivering electricity savings of up to 50%, along with significant water savings and reduced carbon emissions. A powerful cloud-based dashboard application, plus expert engineering support, ensures savings continue over the long-term and customers have the tools to meet their ongoing operational goals. More information can be found at http://www.optimumenergyco.com.

  

Title: Energy Analyst, Building Automation Systems  

Functional Area: Engineering Solutions  

Reports to: VP, Engineering Solutions  

Directs: None  

Location: Nashville preferably  

Job Type: Regular  

Job Time: Full-Time  

Experience Level: 1-4 years industry experience  

Required Education: BS, Mechanical Engineering (or equivalent work experience)  

Required Travel: 25% - 50%

  

Job Description:

  

The Energy Analyst, Building Automation Systems has primary responsibility for pre- and post-sales engineering services which includes site assessment, financial analysis, detailed engineering site analysis, implementation, and QA. The Analyst will support the Project Manager and Project Engineer to ensure consistency and quality throughout the pre- and post-sales processes.

  

Job Responsibilities:

  

* Conduct onsite assessment of Building Automation Systems (BAS), HVAC equipment, configurations, and other details to generate data and inputs for modeling and analysis.
* Present site analysis and estimates to customer technical team.
* Perform energy modeling and savings estimates.
* Perform implementation of Retro-Commissioning scope of work including optimization of HVAC control systems and functional testing of equipment.
* Perform design of energy efficiency improvements and BAS Upgrades.
* Participate in project QA/QC.
* Participate in project meetings.
* Participate in developing reports for customers on HVAC system performance.
* Aiding in analyzing and troubleshooting BAS performance.
  

Requirements:  

* 4-year Mechanical Engineering degree.
* Engineer in Training (E.IT) a plus.
* 0-3 years HVAC/BAS experience.
* Experience in the energy efficiency field.
* Proficient with MS Office Software tools including, but not limited to, Excel, PowerPoint, and Word to generate reports and presentations.
* Good communication skills and excellent customer satisfaction skills.
  

Preferred:  

  

* Detailed knowledge of Building Automation Systems including, but not limited to Siemens, Johnson Controls, Schneider, etc.
* Engineer in Training (E.IT)
  

We Offer:  

* Choice between two medical plans (PPO or HDHP)
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* FSA
* Short-Term & Long-Term Disability
* 401(k) Plan with an employer match
* 15 days Paid Time Off
* Paid Time Off during the week of Christmas and New Year’s
* 10 Paid Holidays
  

Salary Pay Range:  

* $65,000 - $80,000 annually
  

Optimum Energy is an Equal Opportunity Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace.

title: EHR System Analyst
description:
GeekSI is seeking candidates matching our corporate culture. A candidate must be passionate about their craft and think a little differently than the average employee. After joining the Geek Team, they will inherently contribute to GeekSI's reputation of providing the best, most innovative technical resources in the industry. GeekSI forges trust through integrity and hard work, delivering outstanding technology solutions that bring measurable value to our customers. Work hard, play hard!

**We are currently NOT offering Sponsorship. For example, no H-1B, O-1, E-3, EAD, TN or any related sponsorships.**  
**This position is FULLY REMOTE**

Below are some of the responsibilities the System Analyst may be expected to assume in their position:

* Develop user requirement documents, design documents and screen presentations based on user requirements, user input and feedback.
* Provide research and analytical services for defects, enhancements and systems as they emerge
* Meet with the program offices to collect user requirements and facilitate the development of requirements, documentation for defects, andenhancements to the HMS system.
* Facilitate development using object-oriented design methodology and design using the Unified Modeling Language and or Flow Charts.
* Develop test cases and scripts to test the application and provide support, software testing, and quality assurance to ensure that the applicationmeets requirements, per the user requirements.
* Provide work estimates, communication and updates for Release Planning, Sprint Planning and Daily Scrum, daily in the time indicated onthe work tickets to implement system feature enhancements or additions and bug fixes.
* Document and follow Office of IT processes and ensure compliance withstandards and best practices.
* Complete job required training. Completion verification may include certificates, sign-in sheets and/or verification via a Learning Management System.

**The Must-Haves: To be considered for this position, you must minimally meet the knowledge, skills, and abilities listed below.**

* Must currently reside in the US.
* Must have a minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree
* Minimum of 4 or more years of relevant technical or business work experience
* 2 years demonstrated experience with implementing Health Care Systems.
* 2 years demonstrated experience with HMS systems, other clinic management, or electronic health record software.
* 2 years demonstrated experience writing, developing user and system requirements
* 1 year demonstrated experience with Agile software development, project management and testing practices.
* 3 years demonstrated experience in analysis, testing and flowcharting and unified modeling.
* 3 years demonstrated experience using SQL.
* 3 years demonstrated experience with formal software testing.
* 3 years demonstrated experience with root cause analysis and troubleshooting.

**GeekSI now covers 100 percent employer contribution toward health insurance premiums for employees and 50 percent for dependents.**

title: Systems Analyst III-Rev Cycle-Remote
description:
**Why Mayo Clinic**

  

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.  

  

**Responsibilities**  


RPA Developer III – Rev Cycle is tasked with the end-to-end management of Robotic Process Automation (RPA) initiatives, focusing primarily on the technical design, development, testing, and deployment of automations within Epic revenue cycle modules. This role involves leading the planning and execution of medium to large-sized technical projects that support systems, processes, or project teams across the Enterprise Revenue Cycle. The individual will take charge of the implementation process, collaborating closely with IT, Operations, and Revenue Cycle stakeholders to ensure that RPA solutions are efficiently integrated and aligned with organizational goals.

  



This role will be responsible for the creation of solution design documentation, and the facilitation of implementation strategies that leverage UiPath for automating processes within the Epic revenue cycle framework. This individual will manage the installation of new and existing programs, ensuring that system enhancements undergo thorough and accurate testing before their implementation. By leading teams alongside appropriate stakeholders, the developer will develop functional requirements for new applications and estimate resources needed for software enhancements, coordinating these projects with other ongoing initiatives.

  



Moreover, the role includes working with IT to assist in the allocation of IT resources for budgeting purposes, providing sizing documentation for resource allocations, and monitoring these resources closely to address any issues with leadership promptly. This developer will also spearhead efforts with external vendors and/or internal stakeholders to escalate and resolve issues as necessary.

  



With a deep understanding of the Enterprise Revenue Cycle data and database structures, including both clinical and non-clinical systems, this individual will initiate solutions for complex issues and facilitate discussions with leadership to lead effective business meetings. They will recommend and prioritize enhancements to existing computer software applications or hardware, collaborating with Enterprise Revenue Cycle Leadership, IT staff, and end users to redesign systems and workflows for better utilization of computer systems.

  



The RPA Developer III will also document process changes to ensure they are incorporated into training and internal control materials for staff and other users, ensuring systems and processes comply with federal and state requirements. This role embodies a commitment to maintaining a control environment that upholds Mayo Clinic's Standard of Ethics and minimizes financial and legal risks for the organization. Additionally, mentoring and developing staff is a key component of the role, which may require working evening and weekend hours as needed.

  



This position represents an opportunity to lead the charge in implementing cutting-edge RPA solutions within the healthcare revenue cycle management domain, driving efficiency, and innovation within Mayo Clinic's operations.

 **Qualifications**  


Bachelors with 7 years of relevant experience



OR



Masters with 3 years relevant experience.



Relevant experience is considered in Finance Revenue Cycle, Healthcare or Information Technology.



Experience developing RPA solutions within Epic is preferred. UiPath experience is preferred.

  

Previous healthcare experience and extensive knowledge of physician and hospital billing systems for governmental, managed care, and commercial payers required.  

Knowledge and experience with revenue cycle systems, project management, systems analysis and design, software testing, process management or engineering, systems documentation preparation, financial operations, and data management and analysis required. Must be customer-service oriented, timely in responses to requests for service/information, able to manage multiple tasks and priorities, and able to work independently. Must possess leadership skills. Proficiency with Microsoft Office software required. Knowledge of SQL, operating systems, and Microsoft Project preferred. Experience with system workflow (LEAN and Six Sigma) processes preferred.

  



This position will accept applications until March 7, 2024. This deadline may be extended if the necessary candidate pool is not met by this date.

 **Exemption Status**  

  

Exempt  

  

**Compensation Detail**  

  

$80,537 - $118,393 / year  

  

**Benefits Eligible**  

  

Yes  

  

**Schedule**  

  

Full Time  

  

**Hours/Pay Period**  

  

80  

  

**Schedule Details**  

  

100% Remote, can be seated at any site. Standard Days M-F  

  

**International Assignment**  

  

No  

  

**Site Description**  

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.  

  

**Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer**
  

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.  

  

  

**Recruiter**  

  

Ronnie Bartz

title: Systems Analyst - Oracle ERP Finance (Remote)
description:
**Why Mayo Clinic**

  

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.  

  

**Responsibilities**  


Is an active member of the Office of Administrative System Transformation (OAST) team to sustain long-term goals through consultation, process improvement and digital transformation supporting Oracle Cloud Fusion Financials and Project Portfolio Management. Is responsible for evaluating business processes, making recommendations, developing innovative solutions, and improving processes using digital standards and technology. Plans, manages, and facilitates installation and support of software projects or systems across multiple business systems, as well as maintain and optimize existing platforms. Intermediate background in human resources, supply chain, finance, engineering, or healthcare, with expertise in digital technology, including modern Analytics, Process Automation, Application Programming Interfaces and Product Management is required. Understands strategic product direction to inform Mayo product roadmaps. May provide project documentation to support project design and workflows to facilitate or lead teams in the implementation of projects, processes, change requests/enhancements, or training concepts. Participates in design decisions and engages in the testing of system enhancements relative to more complex small and medium technical issues and vendor releases prior to production implementation. Validates that testing is of high quality and complete. Utilizes My Oracle Support (MOS) or other vendor support tools and drives ticket resolution with vendor(s). Works with appropriate stakeholders in the Office of Administrative System Transformation (OAST), IT, Core Domains, and Operations. Works with systems vendors and external/internal stakeholders to identify issues and attain resolution for completeness, correctness, clarity, and satisfaction of stated requirements. Initiates solutions through understanding of data and database structure (i.e., clinical and non-clinical systems) to provide resolution for complex issues. Responsible for creating and maintaining functional design documents for integrations, conversions, fast formulas and reporting and analytics solutions, and partners with appropriate technical resources to create and update technical design documentation. Validates requirement information with the stakeholders to ensure completeness, correctness, and clarity. Validates solutions to ensure it satisfies the stated requirements. Troubleshoots systems software and technical issues and oversees resolutions. Assists in redesigning systems and workflows. Participates in acquisition discussions relative to computer systems. Estimates non-IT resource allocation for software enhancements and develops project timeline to coordinate with other competing projects. Leads and coordinates effective business meetings with participants throughout Mayo Clinic. Assists in documenting changed processes and ensures changes are incorporated into training and internal control materials for OAST staff and other users. Understands and is accountable for ensuring a control environment is maintained to preserve Mayo Clinic's Standard of Ethics and minimize financial and legal risks for the organization. Ensures applicable systems meet and comply with federal and state requirements. Stays abreast of regulatory changes and makes changes, in collaboration with IT colleagues, as necessary through a detailed project process. Additionally, Analysts on the team will be responsible for maintaining the project portfolio advising on strategic initiatives and tracking value. May work evening and weekend hours as needed.



This vacancy is not eligible for sponsorship/ we will not sponsor or transfer visas for this position.


**This position is 100% remote; can work from anywhere in the U.S.**

 **Qualifications**  


Bachelor’s degree with minimum of 4 years of relevant experience. Relevant experience is considered in Administrative areas such as HR, Finance, Supply Chain, Healthcare or Information Technology. In lieu of degree, H.S. Diploma and 8 years of relevant experience may be considered.


Prefer previous systems and process flow knowledge within Supply Chain, Finance, and Human Resources. Previous healthcare experience and broad knowledge of administrative systems required. Proficiency with Microsoft Office software required. Must be customer-service oriented, timely in responses to requests for service/information, able to manage multiple tasks and priorities, and able to work independently. Must possess leadership skills. Knowledge and experience in systems analysis and design, project management, process management or engineering, software testing, and systems documentation preparation preferred. Knowledge of SQL and operating systems preferred. Experience with system workflow (LEAN and Six Sigma) processes. Knowledge of Oracle Cloud Fusion ERP modules including Cash Management, Assets, Accounts Receivable, General Ledger, Project Portfolio Management, HCM Payroll and UKG is preferred. System certification preferred but not required (e.g., Oracle certification).


This position will accept applications until 03/07/2024. This deadline may be extended if the necessary candidate pool is not met by this date.

 **Exemption Status**  

  

Exempt  

  

**Compensation Detail**  

  

$97,884.80 - $137,030.40 / year  

  

**Benefits Eligible**  

  

Yes  

  

**Schedule**  

  

Full Time  

  

**Hours/Pay Period**  

  

80  

  

**Schedule Details**  

  

Typically Monday - Friday Business Hours, outside of typical hours based on business need  

  

**Weekend Schedule**  

  

rare/as needed
  

  

**International Assignment**  

  

No  

  

**Site Description**  

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.  

  

**Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer**
  

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.

title: Tibco Statistica Consultant
description:
**Role Title: Tibco Statistica Consultant**

**Hiring Mode: Contract (TP)**

**Location: Remote**

**Client: HCL/ Tibco**

**Keywords to look for->**

· Statistica

· Spotfire

**Note: Customer is looking for someone having exp. with Spotfire SDK Developer, TIBCO Data Science Workbench, Advance Statistica**

**Job description:**

· Gather, analyze and implement analytics requirements from business users to perform CPV analysis

· Design and implement end to end CPV analysis workflow in TIBCO Statistica (now known as TIBCO Data Science Workbench), to interface with Spotfire (TIBCO Spotfire Platform) for gathering and processing curated inputs for Statistica analysis

· Develop system to achieve an automated Continued Process Verification (CPV) including the identification and notification of Out of Specification (OOS) and Out of Trend (OOT) results . The system will be used to analyze and trend Critical Process Parameters (CPPs), Critical Quality Attributes (CQAs), In-Process Control parameters (IPCs). Data from this platform will also be used to support investigations

· Generate visualizations and statistical outputs for control charts, variability charts, process capability charts, runs charts, distribution charts

· Model data from data sources including but not limited to OSI Pi

· Create custom data entry and date configuration modules using TIBCO's Statistica Web Data Entry component that will be rendered through TIBCO WebStatistica Server

· Set up Alarm Checking mechanisms to detect anomalies using TIBCO Statistica's Monitoring and Alerting (MAS) Server to send email notifications with high criticality to individual product SMEs when an Out of Trend (OOT) or Out of Specification (OOS) is detected

· Create Statistica data outputs to be consumed by TIBCO Spotfire for analytics and reporting

· Periodically test and deploy solutions to validated environments following standard promotion processes

· Create and execute IQ (Installation Qualification), OQ (Operational Qualification) and Validation Protocols

title: Workday Integration Analyst
description:
Job title: Workday Integrations Analyst  
Location -- New York, NY(Remote)  
Experience: 10+

Key Responsibilities

Create technical design specs, perform unit system Integration test, deploy and support of all Workday integrations.  
Configure and develop technical integrations using Workday Studio, Workday RaaS Integrations, Enterprise Interface Builder (EIB), Complex Calculated Fields, Web Services, Workday Custom Reports, Web Services, XSLT, and xPath.  
Collaborate with stakeholders to assess document requirements, review design, and define functional specifications.  
Manage Workday Integration analysis, system configurations, and deployment to production.  
Monitor and maintain interfaces between Workday and internal/external vendors.  
Support SSO, provisioning and authentication between Workday and other systems.  
Participate in Workday semi-yearly release reviews and testing by identifying impact/enhancement opportunities associated with new release features/functionality.  
Provide production support for incident management and integration monitoring as needed.

Qualifications

Current or Past Studio Integration Certification + at least 1 additional integration certification (CCTPP, CCB, Fin Int) preferably.  
5+ years' Workday HCM experience, report writing and integrations.  
Experience with highly complex integrations preferably between HR, Payroll, Benefits Partners using Workday tools.  
Good knowledge of HCM, Compensation, Benefits, Payroll, Recruiting, Talent Management, Time Tracking, Absence Management, Security Administration and Business Process Configuration.  
Strong working knowledge of Workday Studio Development.  
Strong working knowledge of Workday EIB, RaaS, and Web Services.  
Strong working knowledge of SOAP, REST, XML and XSLT, Java.  
Strong working knowledge of BIRT preferred.  
Workday integrations experience required with a good understanding of integration design and testing concepts and integration frameworks (e.g., middleware, transformation logic).  
Data conversion concepts and impacts on business processes (such as Workday iLoads).  
Knowledge of all phases of system development lifecycle, including production support.  
Strong analytical skills, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities.  
Excellent written and verbal communication with a focus on documentation, and interpersonal skills.  
Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment, especially with virtual geographically diverse teams

Position Summary:  

Revenue Cycle Systems Analyst Senior is a qualified/certified analyst in the module/ systems assigned and is proficient in the Revenue Cycle Systems Analyst role. Develops, implements, modifies, tests and administers more complex modules and systems related to revenue cycle system applications. Acts on modifications where warranted. Develops complex application reports.



Qualifications:  

**EDUCATIONAL REQUIREMENTS**  

Bachelors Degree required in related field such as Computer Science, Accounting/Finance or Business. In lieu of bachelors degree, Associates Degree in related field such as Computer Science, Accounting/Finance or Business. plus a certification weighting of a minimum of 12 may be considered. (see Recognized Certifications). Grandfather Clause: Employees initially placed 5/20/2012 are exempt from meeting the educational requirement for placement into that position only.  

  

**CERTIFICATION & LICENSURE REQUIREMENTS**  

A minimum certification weighting of 8. In addition, new version training (NVT) must be kept current.Weight 1 - All Readiness. Access: Benefits Engine, Welcome. Clinical: In Basket, LUCY. Hospital: Resolute HB Insurance Follow Up, Resolute HB Payment Application, Resolute HB Self Pay. Provider: Resolute PB Charge Capture, Resolute PB Insurance F/U, Resolute PB Payment Application, Resolute PB Self Pay F/U. Weight 2 - Access: Cadence, Referrals. Clinical: ASAP, CareEverywhere, My Chart, OpTime, Orders, Stork, Willow. Reporting: Clarity Data Model - ADT or PB/HB, RWB - Admin and Writing. Technical: Data Courier, Hyperspace Configuration, Identity, Scanning.Weight 4 - Access: Prelude/ADT. Claims: Resolute HB Claims, Resolute PB Claims. Clinical: CPC, Epic Care Ambulatory, Epic Care In-patient, HIM Coding & Abstracting. Hospital: Resolute HB Admin, Resolute HB Chg Capture and CDM. Provider: Resolute PB Admin. Technical: Bridges Interfaces, Charge Router. Training: Training TED.  

  

**EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS**  

Three (3) years relevant health care/consulting experience and 1 year experience in revenue cycle information systems including documentation, testing and analysis.  

  

**SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE**  

Ability to work well with people from different disciplines with varying degrees of technical experience. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Detail oriented with ability to handle multiple tasks/projects simultaneously. Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite applications. plus proficient in Microsoft Visio.  




Essential Functions:  



* Performs essential job functions of Systems Analyst plus:
* Coordinates with key user representatives to develop project task plans, timelines and schedules.
* Designs simple and complex processes identifying deviations from functional requirements.
* Develops system fallback.

* Performs application configurations.
* Coordinates build and maintenance of various system parameter tables, issue enhancement logs, etc.
* Acts as a resource and mentor to others.

title: Analyst - Vehicle Systems
description:
Job Description:
**Location**


Ideally, West Chester, OH (onsite 2 days per week). For strong skills matching candidates, would potentially consider full-remote if outside OH.

 **Purpose**


This position will administer programs for USDOT regulatory compliance, MVR (motor vehicle record) monitoring, and Telematics (GPS) activities for a one thousand plus vehicle/driver fleet. They will also be responsible for creating/building new systems to manage the various programs so strong data analysis is important along with advanced Excel, Access or PowerApps skills.

 **Role and Responsibilities**

* Ensure service fleet compliance with USDOT regulations: driver certification, medical cards, vehicle signage, inspections, and ELD (electronic logging device) use compliance.
* Administer record keeping activities for USDOT compliance.
* Conduct follow up actions with drivers and managers to ensure closure of open items.
* Learn applicable laws and serve as the internal USDOT compliance expert.
* Administer the MVR (motor vehicle record) program.
* Manage MVR data to ensure service drivers are compliant with MVR reporting requirements with points in an acceptable range.
* Coordinate communication with Managers and HR when MVR monitor identifies violations requiring action.
* Monitor driver training program and ensure all drivers complete assigned training.
* Administer the Telematics/GPS program.
* Ensure correct data setup and safety alerts are in place.
* Take actions to ensure all included vehicles are actively using Telematics.
* Provide reporting to managers with action plans for any potentially risky driving.
* Provide coaching to drivers to improve safe driving and reduce maintenance costs.
* Lead and assist in developing and improving digital solutions to support the above activities.
* Provide data analysis and digital support for other FSR Support Services functions as needed.
* Initiate and lead process improvement with a focus on digital solutions.


Qualifications:
**What qualifications will make you successful?**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration, Information Systems, or Other degree strongly preferred. (3-5 years of related work experience could also be considered)
* This position requires experience with administration of internal systems and a strong aptitude for managing detailed rules-based systems.
* Understanding of driver safety requirements and acceptable behaviors.
* Must have strong data management skills and experience with data management tools. Must be able to work with database tables and formulas.
* Must be adept using Microsoft Excel (must know v, x and h lookups).
* Experience with Microsoft Access, SharePoint Lists or Microsoft PowerApps preferred.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Able to comfortably interact with employees and managers representing various levels of the Services organization.
* Able to confront challenging issues in a positive and constructive manner.
* Previous USDOT regulatory compliance experience is a plus.

  

Important Notes:

  

This role requires the ability to set up our tracking systems, and manage the data, without a preexisting structure. That’s where the strong Excel and/or Power Apps experience is important. What data management skills do you have? Building tables and databases from scratch? What did they track and what tools have you used?

 **What we offer**


Schneider Electric offers an inclusive benefits package to support all of our employees such as flexible work arrangements, paid family leaves, 401(k) + match, well-being programs, holidays & paid time off, military leave benefits, and more. Learn more about working with us: http://se.com/us/careers

 **Let us learn about you! Apply today.** **You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.**
About Our Company:
**Why us?**
Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.  

€25.7bn global revenue
137 000+ employees in 100+ countries
45% of revenue from IoT
5% of revenue devoted for R&D  

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled  

It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Epicor Consultant
description:
2W Technologies, INC is a fast-paced, high-growth, kick-ass, full-service technology consulting firm with clients across North America and several countries around the world. 2W specializes in helping our clients (mostly manufacturers) get maximum value from their technology investments. We specialize in Epicor ERP, network architecture, managed cloud services, business analytics and cyber defense.  

Our growth has created the need to add an additional **Epicor Business Consultant** to our Epicor consulting team  

At 2W, an **Epicor Business Consultant** takes the lead in helping our customers realize value from their ERP investments. They immerse themselves in the customer’s business and work hand-in-hand with executives, managers and key employees to help make the ERP the “central nervous system” of the business. They combine manufacturing business knowledge and experience with technology to make a difference, regardless of the scope, scale and complexity of the challenge.  

Here's what you’ll need to bring to the table* Knowledge and experience in the business of manufacturing and the technology of ERP (Epicor would be awesome, but not necessary)
* Emotional Intelligence to understand and connect with people from all walks of life
* Communicator who can listen, speak, write and draw to define and shape ideas of a group
* Organizer who can Translate ideas into actions
* Energy and confidence to take on problems and challenges
* Discipline to see things through to the end
* Continuous, self-directed learner
* Bachelor’s Degree in an appropriate field of study or equivalent work experience
* 3+ years experience in Manufacturing in roles related to Operations, Accounting, Sales or Consulting Services, or Project Management in ERP or Supply Chain

  

This is a full time, permanent position with Health, dental life LTD 401K and generous vacation policy  

If this is your new gig click apply and we'll get the party started.

title: ERP Systems Analyst
description:
Your New Company!
  
At Altasciences we all move in unison to assist and work in the discovery, development, and manufacturing of new drug therapies to get them faster to people who need them. No matter your role, we all play an important part and you will have a significant impact on the health and well-being of people across the globe. By living our values of Employee Development, Customer Focus, Quality and Excellence, Respect and Integrity, we look to foster a passionate and collaborative work environment and we are looking for talented and enthusiastic people, like you, to join our growing team! Whether you’re a recent college graduate or seeking your next career opportunity, it’s time to discover your future at Altasciences. We are better together and together We Are Altasciences.
  
  

About The Role
  
The main responsibility of the ERP Systems Analyst is to plan, execute, and deploy improvements to our Workday Finance system, and to respond to user tickets to resolve outstanding issues. This includes the ability to gather requirements from users, configure Workday Finance modules according to the requirements, address defects raised in testing, and then to follow deployment controls to deploy changes to Production.
  
What You'll Do Here
  
* Responding to tickets from users about defect in Workday
* Writing reports (advanced, matrix, composite) related to Financials data (procurement, inventory, banking, AP, AR, customer contracts, financial accounting)
* Ability to gather requirements and record them prior to commencing work
* Organizing and executing projects (using tools like JIRA)
* Configuring Workday (posting rules, FDM values, making business changes, writing custom validations, etc.)
* Understanding finance and accounting requirements and translating them into system design.
* Leading and overseeing testing once a feature is ready to be tested.
* Evaluating new Workday features for suitability with the business
* Taking continual training on Workday
* Configuring budgets and forecasts with Adaptive Insights
* Other duties as assigned.


What You'll Need To Succeed
  
* Educational background in Accounting, Finance, or IT (degree, certification, etc.).
* 2+ years of related experience in finance systems.
* Experience with Workday ERP is required.
* Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Office (Word, Excel, Outlook)
* Must be adept at problem-solving, including being able to identify issues and resolve situations in a timely manner.
* Must possess strong client services and interpersonal skills.
* Must be able to prioritize and plan work activities as to use time efficiently.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities.
* Must be organized, accurate, thorough, and able to monitor work for quality.


What We Offer
  
The pay range estimated for this position is $75,000 - $105,000. Please note that salary rates vary within the range based on factors including, but not limited to, prior relevant experience, skills, education, certification, location as well as internal equity and market data.
  
Altasciences offers a wide variety of benefits to help our employees live healthy and fulfilling lives both at and outside of work.
  
  

**Altasciences’ Benefits Package Includes:**  

* Health/Dental/Vision Insurance Plans
* 401(k)/RRSP with Employer Match
* Paid Vacation and Holidays
* Paid Sick and Bereavement Leave


**Altasciences’ Incentive Programs Include:**  

* Training & Development Programs
* Employee Referral Bonus Program
* Annual Performance Reviews


#LI-AN1
  
  

MOVING IN UNISON TO DELIVER A BIG IMPACT WITH A PERSONAL TOUCH
  
  

Altasciences is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. Our goal is to attract, develop and retain highly talented employees from diverse backgrounds, allowing us to benefit from a wide variety of experiences and perspectives. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other protected grounds under applicable legislation. Reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities during the recruitment process are available upon request. Join us at Altasciences!

title: SAP HCM Consultant
description:
The Consultant shall provide the following Services:

· Provide in-depth knowledge of business processes and SAP recommended practices to support business and project objectives

· Provide primary support for system issue/defect resolution and enhancement design/delivery

· Liaise with Security Analysts to preserve integrity of HR controls

· Provide substantial input to development and maintenance of user training artifacts and system documentation

· Assist with developing appropriate training curriculum and validating training effectiveness and completeness

title: Campus Solutions Systems Analyst (Remote Role)
description:
Job Description
The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Manager of Campus Solutions Operations, the Campus Solutions Systems Analyst is an experienced programmer/analyst who works to support the University’s effort to maintain and enhance the student information system, by effectively and efficiently applying technological and business solutions. The Campus Solutions Systems Analyst acts as a functional expert to support the business processes for one or more student facing departments within the University. This requires the ability to learn and support one or more modules (Campus Community, Admissions, Academic Advising, Financial Aid, Student Records, and Student Financials) of the University’s Student Information System, Campus Solutions.
The Campus Solutions Systems Analyst is a system expert and lead point of contact in the design, development, and configuration of the system to support a series of initiatives aimed at improving the student experience. They possess substantial experience with Campus Solutions, Oracle databases and their architecture, use of SQL, PeopleCode, reporting tools, data interfaces and data process automation. They are highly adaptable to effectively adjust to rapidly shifting prioritization. The Campus Solutions Systems Analyst provides exceptional, positive, and effortless customer service with colleagues within and beyond the institution.
The Campus Solutions Systems Analyst has strong communication skills with the ability to work collaboratively across teams, departments, and the university community. A strong team-player attitude and willingness to serve both as an individual contributor and leader on various projects. When leading projects, the analyst will be responsible for the entire project lifecycle and insuring the quality and timeliness of all deliverables.
Embry-Riddle Information Technology provides remote support with a flexible summer work schedule. Working for Embry-Riddle entitles the employee to a robust benefit package – from quality health care and retirement options to generous education benefits.
About Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University:  

At Embry-Riddle, we take pride in our position as the world's largest and most comprehensive university dedicated to aviation and aerospace. Located in Daytona Beach, Florida, and Prescott, Arizona, our esteemed residential campuses offer a prestigious educational experience. However, our commitment to education knows no borders as our Worldwide campus expands our reach globally, providing a world-class education online and at approximately 110 locations across the United States, Asia, Europe, and Central and South America. This breadth of reach ensures that students can access our exceptional programs without geographical limitations.  

With a history spanning nearly a century, we have continually adapted to the dynamic needs of the industries we support. In the Academic Year 2022-23, we welcomed over 11,100 students to our residential campuses and over 19,000 students at our worldwide campus.  

Join our global community and embark on a journey of academic excellence and limitless possibilities. Employees working more than 30 hours a week can enjoy medical, dental and vision benefits, an amazing retirement plan with immediate vesting that includes a 6% gift and up to 4% match, free tuition for employees and their immediate family members, and a generous personal leave program. To find out more about our benefits and why ERAU has been named a “Great College to Work For” for 13 consecutive years, visit our careers page.
Qualifications
Required Qualifications* Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.
* 3 or more years of technical experience with PeopleSoft or a similar student information system.
* Solid experience in higher education administrative and/or academic computing environment is preferred.
* Ability to support IT Core Values by focusing on improvements, believing in our team, learning from mistakes, being accountable for actions and showing determination, focus and tenacity.
* Ability to work in an application support role, and to convey technical information to technical and non-technical users.
* Ability to focus on mentally challenging technical problems that may take significant time to resolve.
* Knowledge of the principles, methods, and tools used in the software development life cycle.
* Excellent computer skills in a Microsoft Windows environment, including ability to use Microsoft Office desktop tools (Outlook, Excel, Word, Visio, Project, PowerPoint).
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with a variety of administrative, clerical, and academic clients.
* Knowledge of interface construction.
* Ability to lead projects using standard IT project management processes (Agile and Waterfall methodologies) and adjust based on individual project complexity and scope.

title: System Field Analyst
description:
Who we are
With its A.I.-powered robotic technology platform, Symbotic is changing the way consumer goods move through the supply chain. Intelligent software orchestrates advanced robots in a high-density, end-to-end system – reinventing warehouse automation for increased efficiency, speed and flexibility.
What we need
The System Field Analysis Team is responsible for driving site performance from “go-live” to final acceptance of customer systems. Senior Field Analysts are on-site representatives of the Field Analysis Team who are responsible for employing analytical processes focused on improving system performance. This includes system performance analysis, complex problem solving, defining processes and procedures, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to analyze defects and develop solutions.  

What we do
The System Field Analyst is part of the Operations organization that leads preparation and readiness efforts, tasks, and testing to ensure the successful implementation of the Symbotic system at our new customer sites. The Customer Site Deployment organization partners cross-functionally and directly with our customers to drive and execute onsite structural and systems deployments, in preparation for final acceptance of the Symbotic system.  

What you’ll do* Leading bot system performance analysis in support of improving Bot system rate.
* Identifying and documenting bot system defects to ensure improvement actions.
* Communicating and collaborating with technical and development teams to develop bot system defect solutions.
* Enter and update tickets via Jira, stakeholders via email threads, or commentary on Confluence.
* Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports.
* Driving and maintaining a professional teamwork environment and being an excellent team. player while working with various members of the engineering and on-site teams.
  

What you’ll need* Bachelor’s Degree in electrical, computer science, software engineering, Automation Engineering or related discipline preferred or equivalent work experience.
* Minimum one (1) year work experience involving analysis, engineering, or technical system testing desired.
* Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
* Basic knowledge of Microsoft Excel, SQL, Windows, Linux, PowerShell, or Python is a plus; robotic automation experience is desired.
* Self-starter individuals ready to take on increased amounts of responsibility in an extremely fast-paced role.
* A willingness to learn a deeper level of knowledge of all aspects of a complex system
* Excellent team player, able to work professionally with members of various engineering teams
* Ability to work in a rapidly changing startup environment
  

Our Environment* Remote, field-based position
* Travel is required up to 75% of the time. Employees must have a valid driver’s license and the ability to drive and/or fly to client and other customer locations.
* The employee is responsible to own a credit card and manage expenses personally to be reimbursed on a bi-weekly basis.
* *Our* *headquarters* *is in Wilmington, MA. The person taking this po**sition will**b**e required**to perform work at our* *customer installation locations for extended periods of time where equipment is installed and ready for c**omm**issioning**.**(**Commissioning Team)**.*
* The employee is frequently required to walk and reach with hands and arms
* The employee is routinely required to work at heights of up to 45 feet and within restrictive areas of 24 inches. to stand; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
* The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 50 pounds
* Must comply with all safety requirements and protocols, including without limitation Lock out tag out safety protocols and fall protection safety protocols.
* Approximately 75% of time will be spent on a construction site with PPE required (hard hat, safety vest, steel toes, eyeglasses, ear protection, fall protection (e.g., safety harness)
* There will be steep stairs to climb into the structure You may be required to routinely walk up and down stairs to navigate the automation structure.
* You will regularly be near railings that are high off the ground
* Subject to environmental conditions, protection from weather conditions but not necessarily temperature changes. Must be capable of working in temperatures ranging from 105° to 32° Fahrenheit.

About Symbotic
Symbotic is an automation technology leader reimagining the supply chain with its end-to-end, AI-powered robotic and software platform. Symbotic reinvents the warehouse as a strategic asset for the world’s largest retail, wholesale, and food & beverage companies. Applying next-gen technology, high-density storage and machine learning to solve today's complex distribution challenges, Symbotic enables companies to move goods with unmatched speed, agility, accuracy and efficiency. As the backbone of commerce the Symbotic platform transforms the flow of goods and the economics of supply chain for its customers. For more information, visit www.symbotic.com.  

We are a community of innovators, collaborators and pioneers who embrace our differences, because we know unique perspectives make us stronger and smarter. Every perspective matters. We depend on the collective voices of our employees, customers and community to help guide us as we build a better place to work – for you and the world. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

title: System Analyst- HealthRules
description:
Minneapolis, Minnesota
 for this job now!

**Job Description**

**ABOUT UCARE**



UCare offers Medicare, Medicaid, Individual and Family health plans – powered by the hardest working people in the industry. Our people powered teams de-complicate, advocate and always go the extra mile to help our members. We serve with integrity, compassion and commitment to do right by members, providers and government partners. Above all, we come to work excited to provide members a path for the best health of their lives.


**WORKING AT UCARE**



Working at UCare is more than a career; it's a mission. A mission that defines us as professionals, unites us as an organization and shapes how we interact with our members and each other. Employees join UCare and stay because of the opportunity to have a purpose-driven job.


Our strong culture has established UCare as a Star Tribune Top 200 Workplace for 14 consecutive years since the awards program began. It’s a culture that embraces innovative ideas, strategic partnerships, and exemplary customer and provider experiences. Working at UCare is being a part of a people powered team dedicated to making a real difference in the lives of our members and communities.


**Position Description**



As a System Analyst, you will be responsible to serve as the application technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the HealthRules and TransSend applications. Your primary responsibility will include troubleshooting, diagnosing, and resolving incidents/problems and outages in production systems. You will also be responsible for the overall health of the HealthRules and TransSend applications and will participate in application releases, software updates and software administrator tasks. You will monitor, prioritize, and resolve incidents and requests and partner closely with business partners, vendors, and tier 3 support/development teams. In addition, you will provide information on enhancements/fixes to help drive future capabilities.


* Serve as a SME for assigned applications, resolve incidents/requests, advocate for application health and maintenance needs, and understand future state capabilities.
* Manage incident and request queues. Maintain work within defined Service Level Agreements (SLA) by providing timely updates and resolutions. Document all resolution steps appropriately in ticketing system.
* Take ownership of technical issues, including communications and troubleshooting, working with additional tier 2, tier 3, and/or vendor teams to resolve issue.
* Perform weekend and evening support as needed and/or in an on-call support rotation. Participate in Monthly Security patching activities on a rotational basis. This includes shutting down of applications and application startup and validations.
* Create and maintain all applicable documentation as it relates to Application Support.
* Actively participate in Project to Run the Business transitions, taking ownership of resulting documentation and processes.

Proactively work with support team and assigned resource backups to maintain * d knowledge and support for all assigned applications
* Understand Business Functionality needs as it applies to specific applications and the support of those systems
* Help manage third party vendor relationships for SaaS or on-prem applications
* Participate in Projects as the assigned SME to help drive requirements, testing, and third-party vendor work
* Other projects and duties as assigned
**Requirements**

**Education**



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science preferred; demonstrated experience may be considered in lieu of degree.


**Required Experience**



Three years’ experience supporting a customer facing enterprise scale application as part of an IT team. Experience troubleshooting and researching to independently resolve issues and identify root causes including looking at server logs, scheduler jobs, interfaces. Proven track record in managing an application from a technical perspective maintaining systems SLA’s, handling escalations, and working with tier 3 support both internal and external to the company. Demonstrated ability in managing priorities and communicating statuses while developing key business and vendor relationships. Excellent organizational, time management skills, and well-developed written and verbal skills.


**Preferred Experience**



Experience supporting HealthRules or TransSend applications or similar claims processing/EDI type applications. Familiarity with the health care industry and knowledge of applicable data privacy practices and laws. Understanding of relational database concepts and SQL querying. Knowledge of scheduling tools, preferably Automic/UC4. Technical Knowledge of windows operating systems, UNIX, Oracle, scripting, and BizTalk. Ability to read and understand code as it applies to troubleshooting and support.


**THE UCARE DIFFERENCE**



The UCare difference is our people power – employees actively working on the behalf of our members to get them access to the health care they need. We value and respect each individual's ideas and contributions, and provide the freedom to grow both personally and professionally. We are centrally located, and offer onsite education, equipment and wellness resources, and a myriad of volunteer activities. If you're looking for an inclusive environment that celebrates your people power, helps you build on your strengths and gives you the opportunity to truly make a difference, we invite you to .


**Job Details**

**Title**
System Analyst- HealthRules

**Location(s)**
500 Stinson Blvd NE, Minneapolis, Minnesota 55413**Work Arrangement**
Work From Home or Office for Your Day

title: Diligence Integration Analyst
description:
Overview:

Today, SCA Health has grown to 11,000 teammates who care for 1 million patients each year and support physician specialists holistically in many aspects of patient care. Together, our teammates create value in specialty care by aligning physicians, health plans and health systems around a common goal: delivering on the quadruple aim of high-quality outcomes and a better experience for patients and providers, all at a lower total cost of care.  

As part of Optum, we participate in an integrated care delivery system that enables us to support our partners as they navigate a complex healthcare environment, Only SCA Health has a dynamic group of physician-driven, specialty care businesses that allows us to customize solutions, no matter the need or challenge:* We connect patients to physicians in new and differentiated ways as part of Optum and with our new Specialty Management Solutions business.
* We have pioneered a physician-led, multi-site model of practice solutions that restores physician agency by aligning incentives to support growth and transition to value-based care.
* We lead the industry in value-based payment solutions through our Global 1 bundled payment convener, that provides easy predictable billing to patients.
* We help physicians address everything beyond surgical procedures, including anesthesia and ancillary service lines.

  

The new SCA Health represents who we are today and where we are going—and the growing career opportunities for YOU.
Accountabilities / Responsibilities:

We are seeking a Diligence and Integration Analyst who will be fully dedicated to SCA's investment and merger efforts. The Diligence and Integration Analyst will work closely with new partnerships, SCA’s development and operational leadership teams and internal support services departments. This role is fully accountable to deliver a differentiated onboarding experience to facilities emphasizing minimal disruptions while balancing the optimization of SCA resources. The teammate, once on boarded, is expected to work with minimal oversight. **Job Summary**
This position is responsible to support diligence and integration teammates in the simutaneous management of multiple projects with varying size and complexity. Project types include acquisiton investments of Ambulatory Surgery Centers (ASCs) and Surgical Hospitals, mergers of one or more existing surgery facilities and other types of investement or divestiture projects. The role will include support of the entire project life cycle, from the planning stages before a deal is signed to the complete execution of the diligence workplan.  

**Duties and Responsibilities**
The Diligence and Integration Analyst will be accountable for coordinating all aspects of multiple projects simultaneously, including:* Supporting cross-functional teams and projects
* Delivering accurate project plans, dashboards, and other project tools
* Communicating effectively with all parties
* Providing disciplined decision support always involving SCA Support Services experts
* Monitoring and reporting SCA commitments and schedules
* Timely identification of barriers to success
* Balancing SCA diligence and integration requirements vs. customer expectations
* Balancing of Development, Operations and Support Services objectives
* Facilitating the data request process for diligence and integration to ensue data is received in a timely manner and that deals remain on track for a timely close
* Assisting in managing Dynamo
* Collecting diligence reports from multiple departments within SCA and synthesize key diligence findings for presentation to SCA senior leadership
* Facilitating the SCA Operating Model (service/solution selection) process
* Managing diligence and integration tasks/deliverable performance reporting
* Interfacing with external consultants
* Performing on-site visits as required to ensure project success and physician satisfaction


Qualifications:  

* Exceptional analytical and organizational skills, including a proven ability to adapt to a dynamic project environment
* Strong leadership skills including conflict resolution
* Ability to communicate effectively (verbal and written) with clients, stakeholders, and senior leadership
* Demonstrated success in supporting complex projects and interfacing with matrixed teams
* Ability to work effectively with large teams within an organization
* Good general business acumen, capable to analyze complex business problems and provide solutions
* Emotional maturity and personal security—self-aware, completely accountable to outcomes, and accepting of constructive feedback

  

Education and Experience Requirements:  

* Bachelor's degree in business administration, finance, accounting, project management or related field
* 1-2 years’ experience preferred
* Prior experience in accounting/finance, healthcare, project management, or related field

  

Travel Required* 20-30%

  

Min: USD $67,800.00/Yr. Max: USD $75,000.00/Yr.

title: Sr IT Systems Analyst - Epic BCA
description:
Summary:
  

Responsible for the technical health of all of Summa’s Epic environments and the BCA process and application. Defines and implements the change control processes and coordinates key Epic environment activities including updates, upgrades, and build migration.
  

Coordinates all Epic related updates and upgrades and evaluate when and which updates will be taken. Assists the technical / engineering teams in coordinating and planning the Epic upgrades which are currently planned quarterly, four times per year. Tracks all updates as they flow through the non-production to production environments.
  

  

Acts as expert around Epic-focused downtime processes and provides reporting out of BCA. Manages the BCA environment and assists with any system updates and ongoing maintenance. Monitor the environment for any issues. This is critical to Summa as Epic is the primary system for patient care when there is an Epic environment outage.
  

  

Ensures the Epic environment remains stable and works closely with the IT System Analyst (Data Courier).
  

  

Minimum Qualifications:
  

  

1. Formal Education Required:
  

a. Bachelor’s degree in business administration, finance, accounting, information technology, computer science, or related field of study, or supporting certifications of equivalent relevance.
  

  

2. Experience & Training Required:
  

a. Five (5) years’ experience with end-to-end Epic project and program delivery with a focus on Environment and release management and Business Continuity Access to include:
  

i. Experience with Epic change control, environment release, BCA/downtime processes in a multi-facility provider environment
  

ii. Experience working with and guiding software and hardware engineering teams on a technical level such as discussing basic code questions.
  

b. Preferred: Agile practitioner certifications
C. Preferred: Epic Certifications  



  

3. Other Skills, Competencies and Qualifications:
  

a. Strong understanding of hospital business operations
  

b. Excellent handling and management of conflicting goals in technical environments.
  

c. Ability to communicate well with clinical staff, IT application teams, and technical team members.
  

d. Assertive and able to hold team members accountable for following established policy and procedure.
  

e. Process and detail-oriented with excellent organizational skills.
  

f. Demonstrates excellent planning, task management, problem solving skills.
  

g. Very skilled with creation of technical documents such as design documents, architecture diagrams, flow diagrams.
  

h. Experienced with typical project management tools such as MS Excel, Word, PowerPoint and reporting tools e.g., Tableau.
  

i. Develops strong working relationships with colleagues, customers, and across all Epic teams to effectively achieve functional/project goals.
  

j. Provides release management and BCA expertise to broader Epic team.
  

k. Preferred: ITIL 4 Foundation Level Certification (or equivalent).
  

  

4. Level of Physical Demands:
  

a. Sedentary: Exerts up to ten pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently  

  

The salary range on this job posting/advertising is base salary exclusive of any bonuses or differentials. Many factors, such as years of relevant experience and geographical location are considered when determining the starting rate of pay. We believe in the importance of pay equity and consider internal equity of our current team members when determining offers. Please keep in mind that the range that is listed is the full base salary range. Hiring at the maximum of the range would not be typical.

title: QNXT Configuration Analyst
description:
Greetings from IT Engagements…!

IT Engagements is a global staff augmentation firm providing a wide-range of talent on-demand and total workforce solutions. We have an immediate opening for the below position with one of our premium clients.

**Job Title: Senior QNXT Configuration Analyst**

**REMOTE ROLE \\_ ONLY USC AND GC WORKS** 

**Job Summary:**  
We are seeking a Senior QNXT Configuration Analyst with over 8 years of current experience to join our team. The ideal candidate should possess expertise in QNXT configuration, capitation, and comprehensive knowledge of DOFR (Date of First Risk). The role requires actively using standard benefits and pricing methodologies, solutioning detailed business requirements, conducting unit testing, and efficiently resolving defects. The candidate must demonstrate the ability to work independently, meet project deliverables, and collaborate effectively within a team environment.

**Responsibilities:**

* Configure QNXT system components to meet business requirements effectively.
* Demonstrate proficiency in capitation processes and ensure accurate implementation within QNXT.
* Utilize standard benefits and pricing methodologies actively within the QNXT platform.
* Analyze and interpret detailed business requirements, providing effective solutions within QNXT.
* Conduct unit testing and proof of concept testing to validate system configurations and functionalities.
* Efficiently resolve defects identified during testing or production phases.
* Work independently to prioritize tasks and meet project deliverables within established timelines.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment of system configurations.

* Proficiency in capitation processes and QNXT DOFR (Date of First Risk).
* Strong understanding of benefits configuration principles and methodologies.
* Knowledge of commercial insurance practices and regulations.
* Proficiency in SQL for data analysis and reporting.
* Experience in contract configuration and provider pricing within QNXT.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively both independently and within a team environment.
* Proven track record of meeting project deliverables and deadlines.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Certification in QNXT or relevant healthcare IT systems.
* Experience with other healthcare payer systems or platforms.

description:
**Job Title: PeopleSoft Systems Analyst**

**Location:** Remote (Position is expected to be in NYS)

**Role Type:** Contract (W2 only)

**Job summary:**

We have a vacancy for PeopleSoft Systems Analyst to support ongoing PeopleSoft Application upgrade project. Under the direction of the Analyst Manager, the PeopleSoft Systems Analyst shall have the primary responsibility of ensuring the quality of the software and enable FISA to operate and maintain the software application in a cost-effective manner.

* The PeopleSoft Systems Analyst will also be responsible for data/code analysis, creation and review of functional designs, customizations, documentation, and promotion of code using PeopleTools 8.5X.
* This person should have wrought knowledge of the following modules - PeopleSoft HR, Payroll, Benefits, eHire (TAM and Candidate Gateway), eProfile, ePerformance, Employee Profiles (Accomplishments), Absence Management, Workers Compensation, COGNOS reporting and interfacing to Mainframe
* The PeopleSoft Systems Analyst will work on integration of PeopleSoft modules with other systems, customizations, upgrades and patches across multiple environments.
* This candidate will work closely with the Project Manager, Business Analysts, Developers, Testers, and key business partners to design, develop, test, and implement product initiatives to support the Automated Personnel System.
* This person also needs to have the ability to work independently and prioritize tasks to meet project deadlines.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Work in a techno-functional capacity with a good understanding of business processes, relational databases and PeopleSoft table structures.
* Collaborate with release teams to provide analysis, design, development, and testing guidance.
* Analyze and document business requirements, and review functional specifications with business owners for approval.
* Review functional specifications with technical staff during transition to technical design.

**Qualifications:**

* Extensive PeopleSoft 9.x (v. 9.2 is plus) techno-functional experience with HR and Benefits Administration;
* Experience in documenting processes for HR, Payroll, and/or Benefits, should also have five (5) full-lifecycle PeopleSoft HR and/or Payroll and/or Ben Admin implementation experience;
* Working knowledge of app messaging (integration broker) is a must;
* Extensive experience with PeopleCode, SQR, SQL, App designer, Toad;
* Extensive experience working on PeopleSoft interfaces into legacy and 3rd party systems and
* Excellent knowledge of PeopleSoft HCM Database model.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Previous experience working with an enterprise wide, large scale environment;
* Experience working with PeopleSoft Implementations in a government or civil service environment;
* Excellent understanding of systems development lifecycle methodologies;
* Experience working within a matrix environment;
* Experience working with an enterprise wide, large-scale implementation and
* Excellent Communications skills (Oral and written), interpersonal, and organizational skills are required.

**Education:**

Bachelors or Master’s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or in a Technical/Business Discipline is required.

title: Senior Information Systems Analyst - Developer (Remote)
description:
**Description**
---------------


This is a **REMOTE WORK** position where work must be performed within the state of North Carolina.


Performs difficult skilled technical work required for developing and supporting applications that make up the City’s .NET application suite and interfaces onto the City’s Enterprise Integration Platform (EIP). Currently, the City uses MuleSoft as its EIP. This work includes application design, development, testing, maintenance, enhancements, documentation, installations, and collaboration with other City and IS staff members; resolving complex technical problems; creating Crystal Reports; and related work as apparent or assigned. Work is performed under the supervision of an Information Systems Supervisor or other member of the IS management team.
**Examples of Duties**
----------------------


* Provides design, development, maintenance, and support services for custom in-house applications.
* Works with customers and vendors to resolve complex issues.
* Consults with customers in assessing and defining business needs and eliciting and documenting application requirements.
* Plans, modifies, and develops upgrades, patches and enhancements to custom applications.
* Creates and documents policies and procedures for custom in-house applications.
* Supports and manages system life cycles for custom applications.
* Develops and implements disaster recovery procedures.
* Provides design, development, maintenance, and support services for EIP Applications and Services.

**Typical Qualifications**
--------------------------


Comprehensive knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle; Comprehensive understanding of web technologies and client/server platforms and standards; knowledge of Any Point Studio, and MuleSoft Cloud platform; general knowledge of Microsoft Structured Query Language (SQL) server and Oracle databases and querying languages; knowledge of API Methods and data structures; knowledge of custom application development using Visual Studio, .NET, ASP.NET, VB.NET, C#, JavaScript, jQuery, ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, and web services ability to manage crises, which involve complex technical software problems; ability to analyze and apply critical thinking with attention to details; ability to communicate effectively orally and in writing; ability to work under time constraints or deadlines and be organized while simultaneously working on multiple tasks; ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with supervisors, team members, city staff and vendors.

**Education and Experience**


Bachelor’s degree with coursework in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field, extensive experience in information technology and application development and support; extensive experience implementing and supporting applications and systems, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

**Physical Requirements**


This work is sedentary and requires little to no exertion of force; work regularly requires sitting, using hands to finger, handle or feel and repetitive motions and occasionally requires walking and speaking or hearing; work requires close vision; vocal communication is required for expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word and conveying detailed or important instructions to others accurately, loudly or quickly; hearing is required to perceive information at normal spoken word levels and to receive detailed information through oral communications and/or to make fine distinctions in sound; work requires preparing and analyzing written or computer data and visual inspection involving small defects and/or small parts; work is generally in a moderately noisy location (e.g. business office, light traffic).


**Supplemental Information**
----------------------------


**Hard-To-Fill Sign-On Incentive**


This position has been designated by the City Manager as hard-to-fill and eligible for a one-time sign-on incentive. Please refer to the Hard-To-Fill Sign-On Incentive Policy for additional information and eligibility rules.


  
***EMPLOYEE BENEFITS***

* 401a Contribution (employee match not required)
* Bus Pass Program
* Education Assistance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Employee Suggestion Program
* Family and Medical Leave
* Flexible Spending Accounts
* Group Health Insurance
* Group Dental Insurance
* Jury Duty Leave
* Life/Accidental Death Insurance
* Long-Term Care Insurance
* Military Leave
* Paid Holidays
* Promotion from Within
* Retirement/Pension Plan (State of NC)
* School Leave
* Shared Leave
* Short-Term Disability Insurance
* Sick Leave
* Training
* Vacation Leave
* Wellness Program

The City of Winston-Salem's employment practices are guided by federal, state, and local rules and regulations guaranteeing employment opportunities to all persons without regard to and prohibiting discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, creed, color, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy, age, religion, political affiliation or beliefs, national origin or handicap, unless a bonafide occupational qualification exists.
